column4: I was wondering about kernels and SMP. I have a ubuntu fiesty and a ubuntu studio installation on two different PCs here. The fiesty sees all 4 cores of my Q6600 CPU but the ubuntustudio does not, on either generic or low latency.
weird
Would it be usual for a UbuntuStudio installation to not install for SMP?
SMP is default enabled in recent kernels
fiesty installed with smp support on my quad core but in ubuntu studio Its only using 1 core
check boot options for nosmp. other than that, it is strange
boot options in menu.lst? If so I dont see any sign of a no smp boot option
as told it is default enabled with recent kernels
could it be that it isnt included in the Ubuntustudio text based installer dvd? should I just reinstall the generic kernel package using synaptic?
may be they explicitly set off smp for ubuntustudio, you can always install you kernel anyway
if I choose to reinstall the generic packages for both it should work itself out?
don'T think so. But trying is better than asking me :)
:P I know what to do on gentoo but havent twiddled with ubuntu yet ;p
don't hesitate to dig through I'd say
after all , you know everything on linux are files. What could happen worse ?
indeed :) but its sort of a daisy chain haha. I should really burn some of these wireless drivers etc to a dvd. Need another pc just to get Ubuntu up and running atm
haha no dice with kernel upgrade to *-16 from *-15 :) I guess my installations config files are building for non smp?
how no dice ?
it is impossible not being able to install a new kernel. IT's just your old system may not boot :)
I upgraded to newer kernels but is still no smp (through synamptic)
compile it from source
k hehe the new kernel killed my xgl/ati or something
no just reinstall your binary video drivers
ubuntu uses smp already
